{
    "sql": "DROP TABLE IF EXISTS t1; CREATE TABLE t1(day_of_week enum('0','1','2','3','4','5','6'), bit1 bit(1), bit3 bit(3)); INSERT INTO t1 VALUES (1+RAND()*7, 0, 0), (1+RAND()*7, 0, 0); INSERT INTO t1 VALUES (1+RAND()*7, 0, 0); INSERT INTO t1 VALUES (1+RAND()*7, 0, 0); INSERT INTO t1 SELECT 1+RAND()*7, 0, 0 FROM t1;",
    "Affected Elements": "INSERT INTO t1 VALUES (1+RAND()*7, RAND()*2, RAND()*8);",
    "Root Cause Analysis": "The issue arises from the fact that the values generated by RAND() for bit1 exceed the allowed length for the bit column, leading to a 'Data too long' error."
}
